poem:
**Chemtrails and Angels**  

The morning blooms with chemtrails  
stitched across the Florida sky—  
angels whisper their secrets,  
while dark forces, unseen,  
swirl like shadows.  
The surgeon on his rounds,  
guided by invisible hands,  
stands firm, vetted,  
every white coat a cloak,  
each stethoscope a silver charm.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Guided by angels, pursued by chemtrails: the weird world of Florida health chief’s influential wife The wife of Florida surgeon general Dr Joseph Ladapo, a leading vaccine skeptic, believes that angels have spoken to her and that “dark forces” are targeting her family with chemtrails, and has claimed her husband won’t work with anyone she hasn’t vetted. In published works and interviews reviewed by the Guardian, Brianna Ladapo – who edited her husband’s USA Today". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
